column1: Little Goat Diner////Brandade and belly ($14) was an interesting take on eggs benedict. The square housemade biscuits were amazing - warm
column3: and noticeably loaded with butter in every bite. The kimchi and pickled jalapenos provided the much-needed acidity
column4: fried eggs were perfectly runny. The brandade is an excellent alternative to hollandaise
column5: but I think there was only one small piece of (very tasty) pork belly in the entire dish.
